poem:
**Lake Tahoe Elegy**

Capsized on Tahoe's blue pulse,   
six voices swallowed by swell.   
Waves whisper their names—  
the wind carrying echoes   
past pine and granite crags.   
Two shadows linger, lost,   
held in the lake's glassy eye,   
while mourning gulls wheel above,   
etching elegies into the sky's palimpsest.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Six people dead and two missing after boat capsizes on California’s Lake Tahoe Six people have died and two others were missing after a boat capsized on Saturday on California’s Lake Tahoe, local authorities have said. A 27ft-long boat overturned in the afternoon after apparently being hit by a large swell near DL Bliss state park, according to the Coast Guard. Lake Tahoe and its surrounding wilderness region is a hugely popular spot with tourists.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Six people dead and two missing after boat capsizes on California’s Lake Tahoe Six people have died and two others were missing after a boat capsized on Saturday on California’s Lake Tahoe, local authorities have said. A 27ft-long boat overturned in the afternoon after apparently being hit by a large swell near DL Bliss state park, according to the Coast Guard. Lake Tahoe and its surrounding wilderness region is a hugely popular spot with tourists.
